page.title: 17BALMANNO FARM MARYKIRK 2
page.content: The calabrese are sent to{Esk Foods in Montrose for freezing. The mixed vegtables are sold to local shops and potatoes are exported to{Algeria}and the{Canary Islands}for seed. Some are used for cattle feed. The strawberries and raspberries are sold to local shops or to{Cadbury-Typhoo}for canning. Some of the Balmanno fields are flat and some are on the side of a hill. Every year they are ploughed in a different direction and a six course crop rotation is used. The machinery on the farm includes tractors, dung spreaders, ploughs, cultivators, a combine harvester and a potato dresser. There are two full time workers and seasonal casual workers. Bullocks are fattened for the meat market.
